First up:  -Baby Turtle -Gypsy Tan -Pennies from Heaven  All of which were delicious, however the gold was claimed by the Gypsy Tan.    Second:  -Polar Bear -Night Moves -Pantone  All three of these will blow you away.  The way the Bon Vivants have figured out balance of flavor is astounding to me.  They have one of the best grasps on the subject. Not one of the six drinks was "too" anything (sweet, bitter, strong, etc).  Every one of these cocktails was balanced perfectly.  And very thoughtful in every aspect (smell, taste, color, presentation).    The food:  The Burger: Perfection.  Nothing else to say about it other than make sure you order one. Perfect size, perfectly cooked, perfect secret sauce. Just perfect.   Cracklins: Little delicious crispy bites of pork belly amazing.   Brussels Sprouts: These were cooked just the way I love them.  Not oily, not dry, not hard, not soggy.  The sunchoke chips and bacon round this dish out.  So tasty!  Fernet Ice Cream:  I'll admit I was a bit stand offish about this dessert choice thinking it was going to be some bitter tasting novelty. ORDER THIS.  The flavor of this ice cream is beyond and it is so silky smooth.  Hands down this is the best scoop of ice cream I have ever had.  Right along with the Bon Vivants cocktails their food is the same: Balanced.  Pleasing to all the senses.  The overall experience was extremely pleasing.  Thank you so much to every member of the staff of Trick Dog for making that happen.  Every one of them sincerely thanked us when leaving and wished us a good night.    Obviously going back again and again and again.

RCKdmKDZRd-RovZVtNSCLA.review_text: Not just anywhere can I order a drink called the Castro Theatre nor the Dragon's Gate, all SF location-based titled cocktails. They actually had some tasty food items, too, including "manimal" fries and a sea bass crudo dish. Trick Dog even blends up their own unique version of a Fireball shot, should you choose to accept it.  Quite crowded here, but perhaps understandably so. Appears to be a full-blown restaurant upstairs. Shares a hallway restroom with neighboring restaurant, too, so don't get lost when finding your way back!

eAv8E68tQZBqRrmOxkfsvw.review_text: I got here closer to 6pm, and it wasn't very crowded. But give it an hour, and this place gets packed. I got a seat at the bar where I was meeting a friend. Open up the menu to a map of the different areas in SF, and those are the drinks. I thought it was actually just a map at first glance. Their drinks are stiff, so be careful. They may taste like juice but they are strong.   I was really looking forward to their cracklins and Scotch egg, but they no longer serve it. They have updated their menu. Most things we ordered instead were good though. The Kale salad is pretty sizable, and good. The animal style fries (they call it something else) were amazing and we were tempted to order a second one. We also got a duck egg, and that was delicious and on par with what I expect the Scotch egg to be.   The night was fun. Major props to the great drinks and food. Bartenders were awesome too.

dm2zyOFEl2ZMMRGUYjc-Zw.review_text: Had a wonderful birthday dinner here. We ordered every single dish and the notable ones are french fries, fig dish, kale salad and the trick dog. Almost all the cocktail was good but I think my favorite was the mission and dolores (might be because I live here!) Anyways, props for the good food and cocktail!

zZ9NHhDZwZn4gpL0TczK8A.review_text: Fabulous lighting, excellent drinks -- one star down for not having enough spots to sit if you just wanna sip and munch on starters.

Q25NuARY0KB1f-5UfTluAw.review_text: Mixing a bunch of random spirits together and adding a dash of bitters does not a good drink make. All style and no substance.

9L5RsVYJoLN2G0ZpWQiB9A.review_text: This place is pretty cool! Each month they have a themed selection of cocktails. One month it was the zodiac, and another it was neighborhoods of SF. All very different, well thought, and delicious. I didn't think a place like this existed in the area! Great place to hang out!   Its a small space and it does get crowded. Parking is difficult even here..

XgHd-PcVg9n30h1Tab6C7w.review_text: I live two blocks from Trick Dog but never made it in until last night.. (mainly b/c there is often a line & was also under the impression that it was too hipster of a place -- I was wrong). I'm so happy i finally made it in because it is a friendly warm gathering place that far exceeded my expectations in ambiance, drinks and food. Love the baby turtle drink, as well as  the gypsy tan. I had 3 friends visiting from New Haven, Connecticut, so we chanced it & had dinner as well. My friends all said that it was the best meal they had in an entire year. They raved about the cracklins pork belly dish (I did not try it since i'm vegetarian). The kale salad was absolutely delicious. They also loved the Scottish egg. Can't go wrong w/ fried green tomatoes now, can you? The best part of the evening was our server Aaron. He was personable, intelligent and funny. Loved his stories about living in Louisiana. My experience at Trick Dog made me want to move in & never leave.. I hope this place does not become even more discovered than it is (open just a few months & already a mention in the NY Times, all SF papers, etc), because, as is, it is perfect. The creators of this place have done a stellar job in presentation & staffing.

79cVzXhkQg48t2twJ9CTeg.review_text: Generously, the venue can accommodate mayyyyyybe 40 people. Last Friday night, they easily had 80 people crammed into that tiny box of a room. How people even hear each other is beyond me. I went to school in Austin, so I've been around 6th street and I know what crowded is, but this place seemed to be crowded for no reason. No where to sit, no place to lean, hardly any place to stand -- I don't get it.

buhUgeRm7OpQtVE68Q2qZQ.review_text: Great little spot. All the bites we ordered got raves and the drinks were good. Love this little area of 20th Street and all the options available.  Be sure to check their namesake (the Trick Dog).  Cute.

nSqVABmQVazKANe5VgpPmA.review_text: Ok this is a first impression review because I've only been here once and I'm going to keep it that way. I came on a weekday night because Kronnerburger was doing a pop up for two nights! I came at 10pm and they said the wait would be an hour, they took down my cell and I went to another bar to grab some drinks and meet up with friends.   11:20pm rolls around and I haven't received a call, I've been continually checking my phone. I walk back to Trick Dog with my friends and we walk upstairs to the dining area and there's 4 empty tables! Then I tell the waitress that we never received a call and she seats us on the spot- which would have been great but she gave me major attitude not apologizing but actually making it seem like they called and we just didn't answer. She continued to be nasty towards us when she came back to give us our drinks. And she hands us our menu and informs us that the burger is out.. Which is the entire reason we came.so we all walked out. This place left a really bad taste in my mouth. It honestly would have been ok if the waitress would have treated us better.

giGcIU3zUvHxRgxsrlSxIg.review_text: Central Cinema.  It took me a while to work out why this place felt familiar. So here's the experiment:  Walk into Trick Dog, close your eyes, and then imagine you are at Laszlo but they've taken away the propaganda paraphernalia.  Open your eyes: Voila!  I don't know why, but this looks, smells and feels just like Laszlo, right down to the balcony and being 'semi attached' to a fancy restaurant with the whole indoor-outoor feel (but the cocktails are probably better).  So, other than feeling like somewhere else, this place ain't bad. The cocktails are great, the food, while being just small plates are worth the price, and if you want that nice, dark "don't want to know what time it is outside" feel, this place might just pull it off. Oh and they have Hangar One as the well vodka, which earns karma points (but you aren't getting a $4 shot of well here.)  Really it was a good place to have an adult beverage, but i kinda feel like it needs a dark brown chesterfield or something to hide all the metal and concrete and take some of the edge of the upmarket crowd. But this was opening week, so the vibe may change, (but the architecture won't).  Go for at least one drink. Try to Imagine if it needs a mural of Lenin on the wall.

zjfLE9eXx0mtXOoV4mnc8A.review_text: Nice friendly environment, wasn't too crowded for a wed night but u would still have to speak loud to be heard. I ordered the Alcatraz drink and the duck egg. The drink was strong and the egg was good but nothing i was overly amazed at. Some drinks and dishes were out which was a - :( on their part bc there wasn't that many ppl upstair dining. In my opinion, nice place but wasn't as great as all the hype.

GXSbU3uyKGEYsz0gKJ95iA.review_text: Amazing drinks. I wish they didn't replace the Mr Big Stuff, but I understand menus must change :( Bar staff is exceptionally courteous.  Almost always crazy crowded, which is the only thing I don't love.

mzW4uCkSho_MsGEnr25IhQ.review_text: We had the "dealers choice" -- beautiful cocktails from a beautiful, sassy Mixologist.  Visiting from the Midwest and staying in the mission, this was just what I needed for a late afternoon cocktail.  Fresh, herbal, citrus perfection.  When the guy behind me ordered the "champagne of beers" (Miller High Life!), i knew i was home.

AOFDB60pjiXby08lx5HHYQ.review_text: Place is kind of in the middle of no where, but the drinks are good. Ordered the straw hat and baby turtle. Drinks tend to be sweet here.  Wish they had the ingredients for the polar bear drink, which was the reason I came here. Kind of weird that they were already out of the ingredients so early in the evening. Crowd comes in waves, but the bouncer starts a line outside if it gets too crowded, which is good.

joatXGWDRNmw2rHESzfx_A.review_text: I think I found my most favorite bar in the world. I came across an article on the opening of this place last year and kept the unforgettable name in my memory bank as I knew I'd someday find myself in SF. It truly was the most unique dinning experience we had in a very long time. The bar dstairs is hopping while you wait 45-1h for a table upstairs which is a tiny dinning room of maybe 5 or 6 tables. The mountainous kale salad was a great way to start and our entrees, mine the Trick Dog, a sandwich of pure goodness my date's beef "tartare" was superb. However, what made the whole experience so unique was the hand crafted cocktails which were displayed on 45"s in a record album.

FLrVA-P3VlZnBIIwspug8A.review_text: Fantastic drinks - truly inspirational, eclectic and just good. Very creative. Food was quite good as well. I enjoyed the rice plate and Brussel Sprouts.

TZatgTt9RyYGlBa7uZTgBg.review_text: Ammaaaaaazing drinks here.  I always get the Scorpio, but the contents escape me right now.  It probably has Ginger beer in it.  The scotch egg, fish tacos, and the kale salad are delicious but of course the scotch egg is the most special treat. The ambiance is crazy crazy loud and you can't hear eachother at all.  Most weeknights it's the startup /tech crowd.

DHs8No90RxNP6EQHHNEZvg.review_text: Stumbled upon this diamond in the rough on my way to central kitchen next door (review to come).   Asked a gentleman outside, "what is this place called". "Trick dog" he said as he continued to suggest cocktails and lead us inside. Doorman, manager, I don't know but he was one of the nicest people I've ever met at a bar.   Walked inside, great looking bar and people. We quickly slide up to the bar and were handed menus. The bartender was super Nice too?!? Where am I?!? We ordered the Capricorn and the Pisces cocktails. Both delicious and I would most definitely order again.  We stood since the bar was crowded and left after our first cocktail. So excited to come here again! Looks like a great place for parties, dinners, happy hours and a great change up from the marina!

q2RzMzQK8zuwQ-wkjAyymw.review_text: Amazing cocktail menu. Really cool spot in the heart of the mission. The whole neighboord has a cool edgy vibe. This place is awesome - two floors but still feels intimate and swanky. The menu is awesome, all based off of the San Fran. I would highly recommend to anybody who wants a "local experience".

NYPLXaW-ErP19GrZqW3rVQ.review_text: Decent enough bar. I had beers, so I can't comment on the mixed drinks, but I liked the atmosphere. They wouldn't let me in for 5 minutes because they said they were "at capacity," so that was annoying. But, overall, it was decent.

4eR6hYFJcBHoAqhuOS07ww.review_text: Hipster bar/restaurant with no obvious sign on the outside. However, it's totally packed on the inside. Came here for an early dinner upstairs (seated right away for 6 around 7PM on a Sunday). The concept is pretty cool with their drink menus hidden in old record books.  Kale Salad - Wow, I was pretty impressed by how good this was?? I thought Kale was usually bitter but it was seasoned and dressed really well. Loved this Scotch Egg - We tried to share this amongst 5 people and while doable, you should probably order another one. Pretty good but it wasn't mind blowing Beef Tartare - Pretty standard but still good and a great dish to share with a group  There were others but I didn't eat them so I don't know.   I also ordered this non-alcoholic drink (the most popular one) which was this pomegranate (I think) type drink. It was good but for $7 I was kind of disappointed by how they used a super small cup for it. I mean, cmon now, don't be stingy.

Jtfz1WbIB_FtYDkO3MtRXg.review_text: This place is a crowded mess. It's difficult to get a drink and not a lot of opportunities to sit or get out of other people's way if you don't have a table. We got a group together and got a table upstairs. The service was excellent. The food and the weird menu were not great. Cottage cheese with peaches? Sounds weird, but it was good, but also totally not worth what they charge for it. Same for the kale salad. Drinks are pretty dope, but not worth the hassle.

xR3Eyi4FEt1uFhu93xTpgg.review_text: One of mine (and apparently everyone else's) favorite cocktail bars in SF. The Bad Girl stole my heart. All the drinks are aggressively well-balanced and inventive, and I love that they change up the cocktail menu every so often (before Pantone paintstrips, now vintage 45s).  Also appreciate the gorgeous design of the space - love the overlapping/sliding panels that hold all the liquor behind the bar.  I never thought I'd ever utter the words "I want some headcheese taco in my mouth so bad!" But I have, multiple times. That dish and their brandade coated scotch egg are to die bananas Zomgs lol #yolo #fomo...?  I'm trying my best at hip slang, but I'm old. Anyway, what I mean to say is it's really very good and you should probably eat things and drink things here.

bLwnTUzgeAJgqTDOJByGpg.review_text: If you have a gluten allergy don't eat here. They will NOT serve the trick dog without a bun.   This is BS.   Drinks are Great.  So are the bartenders and servers.

yOndrGVXS6cIDMYJ1Vj3sQ.review_text: This place is solid.  I went after work for drinks and a snack while waiting for a table down the street at Flour + Water, and it was a great spot to hang out and have some really good drinks.  I had the Painted Ladies which was was pretty sweet, but not cloyingly so.  We also tried their Chickpea Falafel Sticks which were amaazing.  Very light and airy for something that's usually so heavy.  The place is also spacious, so it's a perfect place to hang out with a group of friends.  Highly recommend!

wzzmDZgDLsPd4eC5JvSrMw.review_text: I've been here a few times and this place never disappoints!  The drinks are super inventive (although I never know what all the ingredients are).  Luckily, the bartenders are very knowledgeable and make good recommendations.  Sometimes the bar area can get very crowded, but the restaurant part is quite nice.  I had the best kale salad I've ever had in my life here.  I know that might seem like a low bar (kale salad) but it was amazing!  The shrimp noodles are not that great but the chickpea fritters are delicious. Get the #10 drink or the st. archer white ale (if you like beer).

CArcKdVqk4hJLdfPyBIm2Q.review_text: Ok, went back on Weds night, and I'm updating my review to 5 stars. Tried more of their drinks (straw hat, delicious) and tasted the trick dog, thrice cooked fries, and cracklins (ALL DELICIOUS). Trick dog burger was tasty (kinda reminded me of a fancy big mac, but I consider this to be a very good thing), fries were perfectly crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, and the cracklins were dangerously addicting.   Service was great. We ate the bar and a guy next to us knocked over one of our drinks, shattering the glass and spilling onto our food. Immediately the bartender cleaned up the mess, scooped up our food, and said "the kitchen's on it!." Within minutes, they gave us new drinks and food. It was pretty attractive, I must say.    Spotted Chef Jonathan Waxman here. If Trick Dog is good enough for him on a late Weds night, it's good enough for me!

TO8KzsrMDiDay8n5QzoVgQ.review_text: I'm not sure what all the fuss is about. We arrived around 5:30 thinking we'd beat the crowd - well we did but being that there's only maybe 10 bar stools in the entire place. Of course they were all taken even by 5:30. We decided to head upstairs, eat and enjoy a beverage while sitting down. First off we had to wait a minimum of 20 minutes for the waitress to seat us, the entire 20 minutes we were staring at the 3 open tables waiting for us. Next, it took another 20 min for someone to ask us if we'd like a drink. Then once the drinks arrived and the food - it was just Meh - nothing to right home about. The drinks were tasty but unbelievably small - especially after what was now about an hour wait if you include, the table wait, the order wait, then the wait for the beverages themselves.   Honestly - I won't be returning to Trick Dog - there are too many decent bars within a few blocks of it. Asiento & Blowfish to name just a couple.

6Dc89_MPk-FBhiImUOkSPQ.review_text: When I think "best cocktails in town," I think Trick Dog. This bar is new, so I found my way to it is by asking the bartenders at another bar that shows up at the top of the list in Google when you search "best cocktails in San Francisco" (Alembic) where else to go for fantastic cocktails. Without hesitation, the bartenders all said Trick Dog! Their relentless praise of Trick Dog's bartenders and drinks convinced me and I'm glad it did because that's how I found my new favorite place. The drinks are pure art and always exceed expectations. They juice all their veggies on the spot too - so yummy!  MUST TRY Buttermilk Punch (it's actually a clear liquid because the milk gets extracted; best drink I've ever had!) and the Panetone (with freshly extracted beet juice!).                                              The drinks do have a tendency to be a bit on the sweet side, so make sure to mention to one of the mixologists if sweet is not your thing and they'll take care of you properly.

n9drbpFg5FpcwB9TGtNhKQ.review_text: Sorry, I know that wasn't the most constructive review. Cool atmosphere, good cocktails, but don't take the inclusive hipstery bar idea so far that it is an involved task for me to figure out what your menu says. I'm here to drink delicious drinks and spend money!!! I'm not here to solve riddles in hopes that a cocktail is my prize.

9nlDM1IetPVrthHrx51XRw.review_text: Drinks were really good, there is no way around that. My girlfriend and I ordered three different cocktails and they were all excellent. The bartender was kind of another story. He seemed really disinterested in us, was curt and came off as rude on more than one occassion. Put a pretty girl in front of him and he lit up though. Hm. Maybe we will go back and not sit at the bar?

oPvWmGBHnLLVaWQF5ZEZ8g.review_text: Every drink Caitlin makes is amazing! Staff is very personable and friendly even during the busiest times. I haven't tried the food but can't wait.

cKmh3yWeADbvKqkZqo0ECw.review_text: **Drinks and bar review only  Round of applause to those bartenders 'cause those cocktails are kickin'! Every drink I had was perfectly made--delicious and strong. Awesome beer offerings, first time seeing Headlands Brewery in the city.  Great ambiance, mellow and modern decor.

ZEL0NHrLsCCTaGMYUlwmNA.review_text: This is the "In" place to be right now in the Mission, I had to go for myself to see what all the hype is about.   The design is simple /industrial which seems so popular around here, Edison bulbs, concrete, exposed Ibeams etc. it's pretty dark, but it's a bar...   The drinks are special and tasty, but pretty expensive  thus the $$$, but this is the Mission not the Marina..... The "Mixologist" spends an unnecessary and unreasonable amount of time on each drink, I mean he's cute and all and can do tricks like shake 2 shakers at once  Wow!!! I just want a drink though!! Which takes forever to get here, we walked out after a 15 min wait and no one even asked what we wanted or acknowledged us  and we were standing right next to the bar the whole time.  Went back in, and found a waiter to help get us a drink, still waited another 15 min. Got a table to try a few of the food items, and again the service was horrible. It took forever to get anything!  The scotch eggs were interesting, nothing else really stood out though, the deep fried sweet breads were over fried and overbreaded.  Probably wont be going back here, $12 for a small drink that takes almost a half hour to get is just not worth it to me.  Service sucks here bottom line

IBrL-6twlZmQBGLdV2DQiw.review_text: Note to self: When opening a bar, make sure it is literally connected to a super trendy restaurant, and 1/2 a block from another super trendy restaurant.  Name your bar using a double entrendre as manifested by a hot dog made of burger meat (damn it, they tricked me!), name your drinks after astrological signs, and voile I will be rich.

YG5EroFMYByZODecz3U_kQ.review_text: So in love with Trick Dog, and would no doubt give it 5 stars if everyone else weren't so in love with it, too. Keep in mind that if you're arriving after 9pm, you may have to wait in line outside for awhile.  Drinks are worth the wait, though. (I recommend the "Ain't No Sunshine" for those with a penchant for sour tequila cocktails, and the "Bad Girl" for lovers of bubbles and gin.) The bartenders are troopers for being able to serve so many people at once. I was literally shoulder-to-shoulder with other patrons; one annoying man kept pushing into me, tilting my stool halfway off the ground. (I wouldn't have fallen because there were 5 other people holding me up from the other direction. Yes, it's that crowded.)  My friends and I arrived at 8pm and asked if they could make room in the eating area upstairs for a table of 6. (Sadly, they don't take reservations for dinner.) They said we'd have to wait around an hour; we ended up waiting for 2. One pleasant surprise after we were seated, though: the food, once ordered, arrives lightning-fast. And it was perhaps the best "bar food" I've ever had. We all shared the kale salad (decent flavors), the trick dog (shamefully indulgent burger-dog with creamy sauce and cheese), beef tartare (SO SO SO SO SO GOOD, my favorite thing on the menu), cracklins (crispy pork belly, rich and delicious -- may induce heart attacks if eaten too often), and thrice-cooked manimal-style fries (OMG salivating at the thought of eating these again).   Overall had a great time. Would recommend heading over at 8pm at the latest, earlier if you want to eat. Also probably not ideal for big parties. Did I mention how much I LOVE the industrial decor? The drink menus, not so much. I heard they used to have amazing Pantone menus, but they've been redesigned as "record albums" -- not the easiest to read. Word of advice: Be sure to hold the menu upright or all the "records" will come spilling out.

pDTAnP-6xHP6K4zrjEnC5w.review_text: all the food we had was pretty good, but just barely good enough to want to go back for (i don't typically go for heavy rich foods)  cauliflower - the best dish we had; the brown butter puree...so good kale salad - surprisingly good beef tartare - pretty good i guess but overhyped trick dog - pretty tasty, but i don't think i'd get it again.  the meat was good but i think for a burger i'd prefer not a hot dog bun manimal fries - pretty good  it's loud, so be prepared to yell at your friends

OW2H-GkKnlVEBPuGHIaiFg.review_text: One of the better bars in the bay area. Drinks are innovative and delicious. A tad on the expensive side, but definitely beats those disgusting long islands and AMFs. Will come here any day of the week over those other disgusting bars on Polk St and the Mission.

yM6heLD8YJjMaA1uEL9-kw.review_text: Great drinks and more great drinks, as well as,  friendly staff and a great location.  Did I say great drinks?  Man, I wish I could make these drinks at home.   I loved their pantone menu, Alas, it is no longer.  Now they have these albums of record 45s.  While it is not a very effective menu, it is amazing. So fun to look through.  I flagged down a bar back to recommend something similar to the 'straw hat' from the pantone menu days.  He recommended "shes gone".  After a couple of those, so was I. If the drinks were not amazing, the menus would just be gimmicky.  As it is, they go perfectly hand in hand!

eGPk5PVd1Xz3DpDMAfkeag.review_text: Pros: Pretty space, great food menu - we've come for the kale salad and vietnamese pork twice this week because they were AWESOME  Cons: Slow service, bartenders strangely clueless and inexperienced   Not sure what the owners were thinking putting together a creative drink menu then hiring such oblivious (and douchey to be honest) staff...  Also, can be INSANELY loud and crowded (but damn, that kale salad is good!)

nCdObC3fNph4HrX8Qfogtg.review_text: This spot is amazing.  Once again the Bon Vivants have outdone themselves.  The drinks are of the highest grade with a type of artists creativity while the food is beyond delicious and like a party in your mouth.   Every time I have been in it is busy but I have had no problems with catching a bartender and watching the magic happen.  Did I mention the space?  Top notch carpentry and design all the way around.  It feels old while new, classy while welcoming and homey.  New favorite spot without a doubt.

LU7ikPXZ5R8tv4oNQZQkKw.review_text: Really good cocktails while watching the Mission hipsters mingle with each other.  I will definitely be back to try the food.

4fyzvgmqraSlfL-g2QUFbg.review_text: Went here for late night drinks for a friend's birthday. What a fantastic drink menu and friendly/knowledgeable staff hard at work.   There's a bit of a line, so I would get there early (i.e. before 10 pm). Inside will be crowded as well, and not a lot of space to sit. But all in all, it' s a great place meet up for a nice drink.   Will have to come back to try the food with all the great reviews :)

o60yRcNLuy-oIjHfNlAEdA.review_text: 4.5 stars.  Didn't eat here, just came here on a Saturday night to get some drinks.  We got there and there was a line to get in.  It's a very small space, so we waited for quite a while.  The bouncer eventually let us in.  Nice guy... wasn't a tough and mean bouncer.. but a nice hipster bouncer.  Definitely hipster inside.  Not many places to stand or hang out, so we went to the back alley way between the bar and the restaurant next door.  Even though we were in the way of some servers and guys getting ice and stuff, they never said anything to us or told us to move.  Even though it was packed, it was relatively easy to get a drink.  The drink menu was too much to peruse, so I just kept the drinks easy.. maybe that's why there were so cheap.  Bought 2 drinks twice, and each time it was like 10 or 12 bucks.  Crowded, but relaxed and easy.  Loud but not super loud.

siycIPpv8ZZaG3QnVlAlYw.review_text: Did not completely understand what kind of place it is. Drinks were really good, doorman and other staff was friendly and funny. Just nothing else to say about here, I felt like it was not my place, I felt  like an alien.  It might be because of the other people.

1ljC2JgUafYC9wtEUXJ3bQ.review_text: Trick Dog was crowded and full of dudes on a Wednesday night. Why?? Music was kind of loud if you're trying to have an actual conversation with someone, but aside from that, I have nothing bad to say. I tried four different cocktails from its spinny astrological drink menu thing and all were really strong, but so so good. See: sf.eater.com/archives/20… Highly recommend the Aries and Scorpio! Probably the best cocktails I have had in San Francisco so far since living here!! Kind of a big deal. If only I lived closer...

m5ssxEA0FTwYpGKi646Rjg.review_text: This dog needs to be put down ... or at least taught to make a good drink.  One morning, someone woke up and decided to replicate Bourbon & Branch, Tradition, RickHouse, etc, but ... wait for it ... in the Mission!  Brilliant! That same person clearly had no bartending experience because the drinks at Trick Dog not only show a complete lack of understanding what mixology is, but are disgustingly sweet.  They taste like someone took a cup of sugar, poured some cough syrup over it, then stirred some bitters in to make it fancy.  I understand a rum and pineapple  concoction is going to be on the sweet side, but when your tequila and mezcal cocktails induce diabetes it's time to revise your drink menu.  Also, the buttermilk punch tastes like vomit.  Whoever thought of that should be fired.   +1 For the ambience and friendly bartenders.  +1 For the food.

IRM1eRvJVTBrOUHNXqHpMg.review_text: I ordered a double burger, and the waitress told me that the chef was 'kind of a dick' and therefore wouldn't serve such a thing. After some discussion, she really got into what a dick he was in detail. A simple 'no' in the first place would have been enough. Although I suppose it is kind of morbidly interesting to know that either the staff doesn't get along with each other or the guy preparing the food has a major chip on his shoulder to such a point that the wait staff feels the need to report it to anyone that will listen to them vent about it. Or something.  The food was okay I guess, but the burgers are pretty small for 10 dollars. I feel like serving a hamburger in a white-bread hot dog bun is a thin gimmick to avoid giving you very much meat or higher quality break, but maybe it is that white-trash chic comfort thing. Either way, be ready for a supermarket hotdog bun being a major part of your meal. And remember, according to the wait-staff, the guy who works in the kitchen and is preparing your food is really a major dick.

UPNuvW7y6aVwhKK5z6eTJw.review_text: If you are in your mid-30s to mid-40s, like to fold your trousers, wear suspenders, chuck Taylors and a fedora - you have found your bar.  Now, the reason for my rating is not the drinks or food. It's the crowd and the ridiculous amount of time it takes to get a drink when busy (which is literally every evening).  IF you are considering going here, I would suggest you go early and leave early. If you do that, you are actually treated to being able to get drinks from knowledgable bartenders (who take their mixing seriously) and good food (if you eat upstairs). The dish that stood out in my mind for some reason was the simple but delicious kale and avocado salad. The drink menu is top notch.

tRN9lFPQ5gK8UmyuN38U_Q.review_text: Bartenders were great!!! Drinks amazing! !!!cute location ! Loved the map of the city and the theme. Will be back soon.

ORYu-cLe0SxineXThaNuYA.review_text: This place never fails to WOW me.  I can say that I am now a devoted regular of Trick Dog. Whenever we have guests visiting from out of town, this is the first place we take them too. Their menus are constantly changing, their drinks are amazingly on point, and the food legit.  Even when we don't have visitors to entertain, this is our #1 go to spot. We've tried every single menu they've ever created!  - Pantone color wheel - Record albums - Astrological signs - SF landmarks  Can't wait to try their newest menu that just launched!!  TIP: drink menu changes every 6 months, so be on the look out!

TLMD9ENh_QVLTOVgzN5UPg.review_text: Stopped by here last night for drinks with a friend. I set my expectations pretty low, but was very pleasantly surprised.  The place is pretty small, so it's probably always busy, but the bartenders were prompt, nice, and courteous.  Plus, the menu is printed on the labels of records stored in old albums. How cool is that??  It was a working night for me, so I had to stop at just one drink: the evil woman, a sweet yet spicy whiskey based concoction.    I'll definitely be back to try what others are raving about: the baby turtle, mr big stuff (served in a pineapple glass), she's gone, and the cracklings!

YKgrNyT29bfbMKMvQnhxVQ.review_text: I finally made it here last night for drinks to cap off date night and have to say that I'm a huge fan!  Given the fact it was a Tuesday evening, there wasn't a line at the door (thank goodness) and we found a seat at the bar rather quickly, which was a huge plus.    It must be stated that the drink "menu" is too cute! I was seriously obsessed.  I ordered the Pantone drink, also referred to as the "beet drink," which was excellent.  The hubs ordered the Alligator Alley because he thought it would be close to a gin martini.  Much to his disappointment, aside from the gin and vermouth, it didn't taste like a martini.  The bartenders here are serious!  It seems that they love what they do and that the cocktails are an art form for them.  It was fun to have a bar seat to watch the alcoholic concoctions being whipped up.

NP-675YVy9URhNmdQdnWsQ.review_text: I guess I had my hopes unrealistically high for the cocktails here, because I wasn't blown away. I probably also picked one that did not seem too challenging, and, it wasn't - The Lombard on The Tourist menu. It had a nice hint of smokiness but otherwise, wasn't too interesting.  However, I thought the rest of the menu, which doesn't all seem to be online, was really nice - high balls, boilermakers, low proof drinks, and some really interesting looking non-alcoholic options - not at all what I had expected! I would definitely be interested in branching out to some of those areas, which are also notably less than the $12 cocktails. Although that did include a free stamp, which I used on a complimentary postcard.

eKUGKQRE-Ywi5dY55_zChg.review_text: Two years ago, I gave up on Mr. Tequila after he left me on the floor at the Palazzo Hotel in Vegas. I woke up to my bachelorette friend and a trio of security guys hovering over me shaking their heads. Damn you, Mr. Tequila. Once Mr. Tequila left my life, I've done some growing up and have been semi-behaved. That's until I saw him featured in the Patone-colored menu at one of the hottest new bars in SF. From the people who brought you Flour + Water, Salumeria, and Central Kitchen (next door) comes Trick Dog, an industrial vintage bar in Potrero Hill/Mission serving creative artisanal cocktails ($8-$12) by cute bartenders along with tantalizing bar food eats. 60's and 70s Motown favorites from The Supremes, Marvin Gaye, and Jackson 5 playing in the background added to that old-time feel. Trick Dog is cracking and even on a Wednesday at 5:30 pm, all the bar seats were taken (hipster and yuppie crowd). Come early as it's a small bar and there's only 12-14 stools. They do have an upper level with tables but all the action is downstairs. Parking is all residential and it may take several rounds to find a spot. There were over 20 artisanal cocktails on the menu and against my better judgment, I ordered the Baby Turtle: tequila, campari, grapefruit & lime topped w/ a creamy egg froth ($12). It was wonderfully refreshing with a luscious creamy and fragrant finish from the cinnamon sprinkled egg white froth: bit.ly/ZFrt6I. I'm usually not a cocktail girl but this one was cocktastic; cocktail-wise that is. I expected nothing less from the Bon Vivants/Owners who consulted on the menu for 15 Romolo among other bars known for their stellar cocktails. Happy hour is never complete without something to nosh on. Perusing the menu of cracklins, mushroom hummus, sweetbreads, the burger, and other delectable eats, we decided to exercise some self-control and order one item, the $10 Scotch Egg. One for each of us because I never share my yolk. Fernet lovers: there's even Fernet ice cream on the menu which I regrettably forgot to order. The kitchen closes at 1:30 am. It's a good thing we ordered two Scotch eggs because it was incredibly delicious: bit.ly/13Xsdem. Perfectly fried to a golden brown, the salt cod (tastes exactly like dungeness crab) encased egg was crunchy on the outside with an yolk that oozed out like lava upon cutting into: bit.ly/13XsfTF. The beet confit, creme fraiche and salmon roe made it that much more decadent. Trick Dog is a great neighborhood bar to distress and drown yourself in one of their yummy cocktails but beware of their not very "happy" hour prices (no hh specials). The tab for two was $80 (including tip) for four cocktails and two Scotch Eggs. Ouchie. Minus one star for a pricey menu in this more desolate area of SF. Nobody ended up on the floor this time after Mr. Tequila's reappearance but he did make the bill less painful to hand over my debit card after downing two Baby Turtles. For those hella balling, Gilt City has a "deal" for Trick Dog: giltcity.com/san-francis…. You can have a private party for 20 guests for a mere $5,000 (cocktails only) or 75 guests for $15,000 (cocktails and food). Pshhh, just the cost of a wedding banquet...

rVA85dMsTw7B6v2opDuMuQ.review_text: My friend recommended this to me, which she heard from her friend. I walked right past the front entrance on my way here, it looks boarded up and there's not much natural lighting inside - it's a large open bar space on the lower level and a more intimate dining area at the top. We didn't have reservations for dinner but it was a nice space to have amazing cocktails while we waited.  We ordered grandma's sweater (I love anything with mint and thought the proportions were perfect), baby turtle, and gypsy tan (which I've just listed in order of my preference). The colors of the drinks are super cool and unique. The menu is interesting with a large variety (see menu at their site).  We ordered the trick dog which was delicious, manimal fries (gluttony at its best) and a soft boiled egg. All were well prepared and unique and tasty, although kind of pricey.  My throat felt super sore afterwards because we basically yelled at each other for three hours straight, since it's so loud inside. That's the only reason I give it less than 5 stars - how loud it is.  Service was average in attentiveness but very nice and friendly. I highly recommend this as a date place or a small group outing (definitely not large though).

TFiC8ns-s93IMMHNH-FBuA.review_text: It's kind of a whole in the wall bar. My friends and I totally wouldve missed it if the security guy in front of the door didn't catch us. It's really small and holds about 50 people. Bathrooms are spacious. Its very HIPSTER. I like it a lot. They have a unique cocktail menu to order from. The drinks are pretty strong for my tastes. It's a fun place to just grab a couple drinks with friends and although it's small it wasn't over crowded. They also have these cool postcards that they'll send out for you if you out it in their mail box! No postage necessary!   Drinks tried: $12.00 each Mission Dolores (tastiest) Coit Tower (strong, slight carbonation) ... gold Fire Hydrant (strong)  They have other drinks. Shots are pretty cheap. Their menu is basically a map of San Francisco. Very cool theme and atmosphere. Give it a try at least once. You have to find street parking! The people here are really nice!

6WUwBSWN7T-16pieaGwVyg.review_text: Come for the drinks, go elsewhere forfood...  After hearing all the hype, we decided to trek over to check this place out one warm Saturday afternoon. After walking about a mile, we realized we had actually walked right by the place... Of course, just like any good little hipster bar, there is no sign to indicate it's presence.  After our somewhat long jaunt, we ordered a few drinks and were led upstairs to cozy into a table (we were also given no fuss for transferring our bar tab to our table +cool points to the staff!). We started with the Lion Heart cocktail... which was delicious, but a tad sweet for our liking.  Then moved on to the Polar Bear and the Pantone (both of which we liked much more than the Lion Heart). Herby, refreshing, complex... Who would have thunk Beet Juice and Ginger would taste so good with Bourbon? (I'm hereby making some excitingly alcoholic revisions to my summer juice cleanse...)  With our second round of drinks, we also ordered the cheese spread and a Scottish egg. The cheese spread wasn't great and the veggies didn't look particularly fresh, however, the Scottish Egg was pretty tasty and was served quickly.  All in all, I think the atmosphere is nice, the wait staff was great, the drinks rocked...but the food can be easily beat in that neighborhood.  With 4 drinks and 2 appetizers, our bill came to $60.

1uYJ4VSggyOwQ9qet4T8CQ.review_text: Great place to go on a date (head upstairs) or catch up with a few friends (space is narrow).  It can get packed on the weekends and take forever to get a drink since most people come in for the craft cocktails.   Drinks are very tasty here and extremely creative. When they first opened they had the pantone menu now they use an album with records to display their drink options.   Shared the beef tartare and it was good but not exceptional.   Current fav drinks:  "Mr. Big Stuff"  (see pineapple drink pic) and "Eye of the Tiger". The Eye of the Tiger was mouthwatering, tangy, and refreshing.  Mixing the condiment honey mustard, apple juice, lime, and mezcal (among other ingredients) was delicious! Who'd have thunk it?

r8YrTMjERM32vGUHfAw6Zw.review_text: Scorpio drink 5/5 Libra drink 4/5 Kale salad 5/5 Scottish egg 3/5 Trick dog 5/5 Manimal fries 3.5/5 but my bf says it's a definite 5/5 lol Jalapeño poppers 5/5 Service 5/5 Price 5/5

CyOO85umQsRECjLuNCimyg.review_text: Fun and delicious cocktails. amazing kale salad. Ugh, trick dog, you have ruined me for any other kale salad.

LTI86BSXBclY6UsZXqKYXw.review_text: Why Hello Trick Dog! ?  New bar in the Mission District serving CLEVERLY Crafted and NAMED drinks! Best of all they are delicious! There is a downstairs and upstairs level. The upstairs level is reserved for people who are dining at the bar.   DRINKS: Baby Turtle- EGG WHITES + Cinnamon  + TEQUILA! WOO. Frothy start to the night. (This was available the first time I was here when they had a Pantone menu)  Bank Robber - RYE, Bourbon, Congac, bitters, and blackberry. Amazing combination to give a well balanced by strong flavored drink. (The menu is a vintage disc set)  FOOD:  Beef Tartare: Sous-vide rare sirloin, egg yolk, cornichons, mustard and fines herbs, served with toas. The egg yolk mixes well with the beef.   Cracklins: Pork belly cooked crispy, with brown sugar, salt & spice- These are great chips to go with the bar drinks!!  Overall, one of the coolest bars in the Mission! Coming back again for sure.

1A-geB-PQr1uveSFOS7Feg.review_text: Great HH spot. Haven't been for dinner yet, but definite will be at some point.   The drinks are well-balanced and delicious - so many great options to choose from. Of the ones we have tried, Alcatraz was the best.  Food here is also stellar. Really appreciate the attention to quality, fresh, seasonal ingredients.   A short-list spot for sure.

NCroaXuzRxhOtfaxQ90f9Q.review_text: The food was outstanding.  Would go back again but not a friday nght at 6.   Noise level a little high for me. LindaT

GrktSJ7Bv9t37gwDLIlAwg.review_text: What is this? A super hip bar with stellar cocktail menu designed by the Bon Vivants that changes occasionally. Expect a long wait and loud crowds inside. The cocktails are unique and themed. The menu is usually a statement itself. Their current menu is the SF Tourist Map. My favorite of this is Sutro Baths, which incorporates Sightglass Coffee, located just next door. Lombard Street and Coit Tower were nice for the summer. Their dining menu is small, but you'd get to sit upstairs if so.

iLjMdZi0Tm7DQxX1C1_2dg.review_text: Trick Dog opened up in SF well after I left the city for the east coast, so upon my return to the Bay Area, I made it a high priority to check it out. After so many years of following the Bon Vivant guys, I'm stoked they have a brick and mortar to call their own... and they seem to be rippin' and tearin' their way into SF cocktail bar glory.  Their converted warehouse is the perfect setting for a well curated libation, and the fact that they're open at 3:00pm on weekdays means Summer Fridays have a new best friend.   I didn't have a chance to try their food (someday) as I was there to tap into the drink menu, and it certainly lived up to expectations. Dozens of creative elixirs dotted the menu (that's comprised of 45s - brilliant!) with seasonal ingredients being the biggest takeaway. All sorts of stone fruit and seasonal melon beverages made it hard to select just one... but really, you could just throw a dart at a page and chances are you'll be happy.   The service was slightly aloof, but I suppose it was early in the day and dude behind the bar was just cracking his knuckles for the afternoon. Probably the only bummer part of my quick jaunt. Not disenchanting enough to keep me away for future visits, though.

4RUXeyp_Af2C5t9JFyJlBQ.review_text: This place is awesome. I've been here twice already.  The drinks are strong and so good. They changed menus since I went the first time, but both have had amazing tequila drinks (you know how I like it!) I think it's probably one of my favorite bars. The chocolate beer was also delicious.   Second time I went, we got some food with friends as well. We ordered 3 different dishes. The Trick Dog which was the burger was great and juice and so delicious. The scotch egg was also great. Big portion and definitely I can tell why there are so many reviews on it. But I think the best dish was the Kale Salad. I've had some other kale salads before and this one was just so delicious. However, I will say, not the best to eat when I'm drinking haha.   Definitely recommend this place. LOVE IT.

1VwFLAb_vq1R1Q3VdMw5-Q.review_text: This place has been in my bookmarks and finally we made it. It was surprising that there was no sign for this place. It is a nice environment to walk and hang out. I had a cocktail which was pretty good and my husband had a beer. It is more like a cocktail place. They do not have tap beers. Generally, the foods was good! Great place for cocktails!

mqQoaNHB4cVtqjLQEGN8vw.review_text: Great cocktails but drinks take forever! A bit pricey for something out of the way and a bit loud.

kfj_SYsJLCLCb5JKY9wI0g.review_text: Love the drinks, off the hook! The people I try to do my best not to dislike them, but guys you are making me work really hard at it.

G9VQqTqWqXx3oLcyOpvzrQ.review_text: A great bar with even better cocktails! I had the Scorpio cocktail that was absolutely delicious, most satisfactory. I had a taste of the Virgo cocktail, which was sweet and somewhat fruity.   The food is better than expected for bar food. Eating family style, we were able to try many plates among us. The fried zucchini and beef tartare as our appetizers, both having interesting and one of a kind tastes. The scotch egg was made very well, and tasted exquisite. Definitely the fish tacos stole the show, the fish was crunchy and moist, with a delicious taste.   The bar was packed on the Friday night we went. A good crowd, and even better service. Starting with the bouncer, Kenny was friendly from the start we walked in. When we were seated at the tables, the waiter recommended great cocktails and food

ofrJRa6kjN-bfSCvzUUyMQ.review_text: The drinks were properly precious. The bartender aptly tattooed. The steak tartare was good. The scotch egg wasn't my thing (the salt cod btw the egg and the crust didn't suit me).  And absolutely packed by 6:05pm.

OFPNE_TTnl9TAEQxrTK23w.review_text: 2nd favorite scotch egg. Must try.  Drinks to die for with constantly updated menus.   So many people.  I just can't deal with such crowds. I literally fight to give me money to someone and get drunk off really tasty cocktails.   So popular. So many people.  Did I say that? What else. Go check it out for some bomb-tastic drinks, but as a crowd hater, I'll avoid on popular nights. Time is money and I'm giving you me money? I'll pass on those nights. Otherwise, yum.  Cheers!

lFdcgrMkHCmvTjMEw4CVDQ.review_text: Fun cocktail bar in the middle of Potrero/mission border. Awesomely designed space with dim lights.   Their wannabe piña colada in the pineapple cup is yums.

itUIJztLr8wIrRRa645U6w.review_text: i went here on consecutive nights, friday night at around 6:30 and saturday at around 4:30. two different experiences. friday night we sat upstairs for a quick bite and drinks. the cocktails and food were all good, but the upper level has no ventilation at all and the decibel level was at nine M-80's. you will not want to linger up there. saturday was definitely more relaxing. we grabbed two stools at the bar and were able to have a conversation and enjoy their cocktails. the common denominators on both evenings were perfectly mixed drinks, friendly service and chill music.  this is a good spot for pre-dinner drinks and snacks (they open at 3pm) at the bar. a very nice addition to the neighborhood.

w40RBx54s0wLN9XhrfsVCA.review_text: This bar is awesome! My coworker took us here one random afternoon and the ambiance is very nice and clean. I love how they switch their menu's every 6 months into something creative. This particular time was a map of SF and they had drinks based on the districts! You could also take one of their postcards and put it in the mail and they will mail your postcard for free! They said that there are new drinks every 6 months.   The bartenders are super knowledgeable and you can tell that they have a passion for what they do. Their drinks are very unique and you can tell that there is a lot of pride in each drink.   Definitely worth checking out if you are in the area!

mXbIphHQwWKeAM-RwWkaaQ.review_text: Came here for drinks on a Friday night and it was crowded and expensive at $12 per cocktail but otherwise awesome. The bartenders have got skills and they have 12 awesome, totally different types. The bartenders move really quickly and are always looking out for new orders but it does take awhile to get a drink because of the crowd.   Great to start the night and have tasty cocktails.

dIiTs5qYYQNuJd7L-K9ldw.review_text: I bookmarked this place a few weeks ago and some friends made a suggestion to come sip on some drinks this past weekend.  I came here on a Saturday afternoon and it wasn't overly packed.  I can imagine at night it probably becomes elbow to elbow.  The drinks I had:  Pennies from heaven (my fav here): rye and almond flavor... sups boozy Vintage photo: boozy and delish  I also tasted: Gypsy Tan, Grandma's sweater, Pantone (***), and Lion Heart.  After a few drunks and a little tipsy I ordered some bites... I ordered the thrice fried fries (sooo good) and the chicharrones ( sooo good).  Will definately come back to try their other drinks.

m4R3Gl3qyYRqkl9HLn5diw.review_text: I like this place! I haven't been able to sit down upstairs and eat BUT I did order a burger at the bar. Honestly, one of the best burgers I have had. Served on a brioche hot dog bun (burger shaped to fit the bun) and they buttered that puppy up. Added thousand island (its like a gourmet in-and-out). Cooked to a perfect medium rare, it tasted like popcorn....no joke. I was sipping on a negroni (with 209, on the rocks) and I was a happy happy camper.

pXzn-YXxzp2_urtJXD_iLQ.review_text: The drinks are incredible and unique.  Trick Dog moves away from the bitter/heavy drinks found at other popular establishments and towards the sweeter, mellower variety, but they do it well.  Pennies from Heaven is my favorite here - it's complex and full of different flavors.  The punches are likewise delicious and go a long way.  The place is usually packed, but it's a fun crowd.

xqOz8ILuuGOlOD2yHOnGaQ.review_text: Trick Dog has been surrounded with a lot of hype as of late.  Naturally, it being the newest watering hole in San Francisco, I had to check it out.    I was not disappointed!  I wish I could knock off just half a star, due to the fact that there was a LINE to get in.  At 8:00PM on a Friday night. And I don't do lines...But I digress...  The beverages are artfully crafted--not just thrown together.  I saw one of the mixologists measuring with a beacon, another with an eye dropper.  It was something straight out of Chemistry 101.  These boys are skilled.  Loved their attire, also: dapper, sharp, and pleasing on the eye.    I enjoyed the 'Pantone'- a bourbon based cocktail, mixed with fresh pressed beet juice, ginger, combier, kummel, and lemon, served up.  Also, the bartender overheard me inquiring about the 'Baby Turtle'- a mixture of tequila, campari, fresh pressed grapefruit juice, lime, egg white, and a dash of cinnamon.  Next thing you know, POOF, one showed up in front of me.  He had 'accidentally' made an extra. ;)  Nice folks there.  The industrial- chic decor is refreshing, and the crowd is filled with beautiful people.  Fantastic for a pre-or post-dinner drink.  Enjoy!

8b9GJsvhIfbyLRyFTbIUqQ.review_text: pro - great price, value, awesome drinks and food, really creative  con - hipsters, they're everywhere, but that's like complaining about pigeons in the park

PcEA6B2wN1j0ejKzSlSOzw.review_text: 4.5 stars, a slight negative for the lack of atmosphere.   Bartenders can vary, some awesome, some not very friendly. But they have DELICIOUS whiskey drinks. Definitely one of my favorite cocktail bars in the city. My favorite drink so far is Alcatraz; the bourbon and horseradish go together wonderfully. The Coit Tower was pretty good too.   Good stop for a drink and people watching, but a very bland atmosphere/seating (or should I say lack of it?)  Go to Trick Dog for a good cocktail; they will not disappoint.

irFk4niiXe5iR-C7mgjy_w.review_text: My favorite thing to do at Trick Dog is to grab a table upstairs, so I can have some delicious food as I sip on cocktails. The recommendations from the servers have always been awesome -- and the food is really good, too! Standouts from my last meal there include the fried green tomatoes, totally standout beef tartare, scotch egg, kale salad, and popcorn ice cream for dessert.  NOMS!  The bar downstairs is often incredibly crowded and you have to yell to hear each other and elbow throw (and be elbowed through) a crowd six deep around the bar. Not fun. I always hold out for a table, or go somewhere else.

dW2uIz60INteoC5w1_k2aQ.review_text: You know 'that bar' you cannot stand?   Walked out of TrickDog in the mission. Washing the smug off me now surrounded by the next wannabe Mark Zuckerberg ( I know the irony) but they make you wait in line... Bar tenders call themselves mixologists...   This is that bar.  Pretentious  Smug Lousy Pompous  Muggy Lousy  Only went there to meet friends then we bounced and went to the Jay N Bee club. Skip it.

TJLxgPLcIA5Oat91_xTfqQ.review_text: Awesome, all around. Really friendly staff, very well-balanced creative cocktails (I make cocktails for a living) and don't overlook the food. The trick dog is the best burger I've had in a long time, and the fried green tomatoes were perfect. Good job Trick Dog. I'll be back.

6wX18iXbPGNdaUzeeZuWIw.review_text: One of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco, hands down!  Their menu is small, but full of amazing choices that they rotate regularly.  It's kind of tapas style, making this a great place to meet and bring friends.  They have the most creative drink menu too... It's based upon the signs of the horoscope.    Everything here is made fresh and with the highest quality care and ingredients, from the bar, to the kitchen.  The bar itself is always packed and pretty loud, but the dining area doesn't really pick up that noise.  I don't think they take reservations, but their dining area is also small so it can take a while to get a table on a good night.    The entire place was put together with a very industrial design in mind.  You can tell that they were paying attention to all of the details (even though I found a light fixture that was installed backwards from the others).  :)  The staff is all friendly and hard working.  You can't ask for much more than that.  If it's on the menu when you go, be sure to get their beef jerky (with horseradish), kale, or scotch egg.  Everything has been amazing, but those are some of our favorites.  I'd recommend this restaurant to anyone any day of the week!

Hxh8sM1kzFIz_5ofv1ZM7g.review_text: Cool & original concept. Two stories where the bar is located on the first floor where they offer their full food menu and the dining area on the second floor. Located near a lot of warehouses on a poorly lit street so just look for the building with a bouncer in front.  Drinks are well thought out - tried the "Grandma's Sweater" which was a perfect mixture of sweet + tart, however shared a carafe of their punch with my friend and was waaay too sweet, wish they had let me try it beforehand! Between my friend and I we tried the Trick Dog, the Scotch Egg, and a pickle board. I would recommend getting the pickles to munch on throughout the night as it is a decent portion. The Trick Dog is basically a hot dog-shaped burger. SO DELICIOUS. I wouldn't recommend sharing this unless you are prepared to fight for the last bite. Overall, the service was very attentive, the food was satisfying and the drinks were A-OK. I'll definitely be back to give some other cocktails a try.

52w4wUCZejomu5YcpJ3GfA.review_text: Walked in and stood at the bar for 28 minutes and was never once acknowledged by the staff. Yes it was busy but people that came in 15-20 minutes after us were served before us. Waited patiently and respectfully trying to get a bartender's attention, but got me nowhere. Really disappointing. Walked out. Won't be back.

3qMnJT5k3sSA565d7N4r6A.review_text: I came here last night to meet a friend who suggested the bar.  It's a little off the beaten path, but easily accessible from the Mission.  We arrived around 9 PM on a Thursday night and there was a good crowd!  Not so crowded I wanted to run away but enough people to feel like I had found the cool spot to be :P.  My friend told me that they are know for their great cocktails and I would have to agree!  With an adorable paint color- type menu, Pantone colors assigned to each drink and unique, fresh ingredients - you can't go wrong.    First, I tried "Grandma's Sweater," which I loved!  It was sweet but decently strong and the fresh mint really added to the drink.  I also had a "Baby Turtle" which wins for most adorable name.  This drink was less sweet but still delicious with grapefruit and hints of cinnamon.  I'm usually more of a wine/beer girl but I'll definitely keep Trick Dog in the rotation of bars to frequent in the Mission!

ngqOVRu_YDy7j5jSIpAlYw.review_text: Any bar that is versatile enough to be great for a nice date or for watching the superbowl deserves an honorable mention! Airy, sunny and a little industrial feel during the day, dark and cozy atmosphere at night. It's not a large space, but still feels pretty open.The upstairs loft has a bunch of tables for a nicer sit-down drinks and snacks experience. The best part is of course the cocktails! I've tried the Pantone, Gypsy Tan, Pennies from Heaven and Night Moves (not many places do a good drink with coffee flavor!) and they were all really well-balanced and delicious. The bartenders are friendly and skilled-despite a lack of suspenders or carefully sculpted hipster facial hair. The food is also definitely worth trying-particularly the scotch egg and the brussel sprouts.

doBSv4mhw23cJELybPBpAw.review_text: My friend wanted to go to a chill bar with cocktails and good food. I found Trick Dog on Yelp, and it might be one of my new favorites. The atmosphere was perfect for us. The building is industrial, which is normal for the neighborhood, and I couldn't really see the sign if there was one but it appeared to be the only bar on that block.  We went on a weekday, so it's hard to tell how packed it gets on weekends. It was busy for a Thursday night, and there was plenty of room to stand, walk around, and even sit (always a plus).  The fact that the menus change in a creative manner was awesome. When we went, the menu was a map with drinks named after places around SF. I recommend the Painted Ladies. Deliciously sweet and refreshing like a mint moquito but less minty. I also had the Golden Fire Hydrant, which was good but not as unique in flavors.  For food, we had the fish tacos and fries (manimal style). Considering how dark it was, we could not figure out what the "manimal" was. Either way, both dishes were awesome.   I knocked off a star based on service. We rarely saw the waitress before we were seated and while we were eating. Our drink order got lost at some point, and she didn't own up to it so that was a little weird. I'm lenient when it comes to service, and it's a bar/restaurant so I would lower my standards anyway. Getting a drink downstairs wasn't terribly difficult, and that's more important :)  Also, the person that made the menu on their mobile site needs to sell his/her services to every restaurant! It is not just a PDF document!

WjCz9whSc4mP8e5MNI8CVA.review_text: Went on a Friday evening and the place was packed. Occasionally can actually hear the tunes that are playing above the roar of the crowd. Difficult to converse but had a great time. Fun crowd. I have no clue how the bartenders can keep track of drink orders, mix the drinks, have them delivered to you in the crowd and, deal with the tab. Really enjoyed the Louie Louie and my wife loved her Bad Girl.

VN6PVnB27j-60xqtIbpNtQ.review_text: Love this place! Cocktail menu is amazing. If you eat you have to try the cracklins'.

E7QXBiJYyH_XFQHuT2fiGQ.review_text: Probably one of the most capable bar tending staff I've seen. Good recommendations, helpful advice and capable of juggling multiple orders from varying party sizes at once (including an unexpected group of about 15-20 tourists). Handled without disturbing the flow of drink orders from the rest of the bar.   Drinks were well executed and delicious.

8qtsJtmefjJZIFM6_Ksd7A.review_text: I met the Bon Vivants at a food/wine/cocktail show in SF a few years ago and I still remember the cocktail I tried.  The Radio Flyer.  Wild Turkey, dried cranberry infused Cocchi Americano, Tomahawk Bitters and a pickled cranberry garnish.    I was impressed.  With that in mind, I had high expectations for Trick Dog and they did not disappoint.     We went to see Eddie Izzard (woo!)  at Z-Space around the corner and stopped in for a pre-show cocktail.  The line was about 6 people long at 8:30pm which wasn't too bad.  It moved quickly and the doorman was friendly ...  giving us updates on how much longer it might be and thanking us sincerely for being so patient.   Waitstaff and bartenders were equally friendly and service was quick.   Upon entering and finding a spot to squeeze in we were acknowledged immediately and given a drink menu to peruse.  The Panettone card style menu is a little large and therefore a bit unwieldy to flip through but on the other hand it is creative and definitely convenient.   You can just pick what you want and hand it back to the bartender rather than try to shout over the din.     We tried the Gypsy Tan and Pennies From Heaven.  Both were complex and delicious.  If we didn't have a show to attend we would have gone back for another round and tried the food but we'll have to wait until next time.  Sadly, the line was way too long (30 people or so) after the show ended (around midnight) so when we return it'll have to be early.  YMMV.    Loved the decor and people watching.  Since the space is pretty small it gets warm inside, especially upstairs ...so be prepared.   Street parking in the area is not too bad.  Restrooms are shared with the restaurant next door but weren't crowded at all and were practically spotless.  Is the crowd pretentious or hipster?  Eh...  I dunno...    I didn't get that vibe but then I'm a little older than most of the folks who were there so I also didn't particularly care.  I'm not trying to compete with or impress anyone.  I'm just interested in good food, good drink and good atmosphere and Trick Dog delivers.      We'll be back.  Saving a star for the food until then.

-jRu-ow3vczQ3zmfVleSFg.review_text: It is easy walking past this place mistaking it for an apartment building. A very cool modern apartment building. The bouncer outside the door gives it away though.   Inside is just as nice with a chill and intimate vibe. The drinks are interesting and strong. This is a great place to sip cocktails with friends or with a date.

TYR6q2SlUt6t-4olbplstw.review_text: Great drinks! Take your time picking one out, there are great choices.

i5Cm53q0pmklQsX8soi3tw.review_text: Get a table to avoid the line. The don't let anyone in until someone leaves, so the wait is variable!  But you can ask to be seated upstairs for some food and drinks. My boyfriend and I had already eaten dinner, so all we wanted was dessert - which was a-okay with them!  Drinks - so awesome. They give you a deck of cardstock that resembles different shades of paint. But instead of different shades of paint, each card has a different drink description!   We ordered: -Grandma's Sweater - DELICIOUS. It had Gin, Lime, Mint and Bitter Lemon....there was so much mint in it that you could barely taste the alcohol. So wonderful. -Straw Hat - skip. Tasted so bland compared to Grandma's sweater. Boring drink. -Ice cream special of the day, which happened to be POPCORN flavored. This was a real treat!!!  We were pleasantly surprised. This seemed like ice cream from Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous or Humphrey Slocombe. The ice cream also tasted fresh, not frozen for a couple days!!!  Can't wait to return!

ruoUnyWT8hrBRG6mXs4_yg.review_text: I'll preface this by saying that I'm bored of "mixology" bars. There's nothing bad about Trick Dog except a line to get in and a somewhat gimmicky drink menu.  I had a "Pantone", which was moderately interesting in that it contained beet juice and otherwise mostly uninteresting. I'm sure the intent is that i'll enjoy ordering drinks as if I'm choosing color swatches in a paint store, but it just frustrated me.  The crowd was good, but it didn't have the comfortable feel that I like in my favorite bars. All said, I'd probably be happier in a Sherwin Williams.  I'll probably give it another try pre-dinner sometime, but it didn't feel like a destination for me.  Other reviewers seem really impressed, so perhaps I missed something.

skar1XyXyjTKKUawy-NlyA.review_text: Consistently been a hip cool spot with a hipster vibe.   Been here a few times.   The drinks are pretty interesting, and it did apparently get recognized as one of the top 50 bars in the world.    I've gotten just the cava, and I've  also had the bartender whip me up a drink based on a few suggestions.  She did a great job.  It took a while to concoct but it was really good.  Definitely plan to go back and try more.

6ukaJ8F5c0hMvEgD8us8Uw.review_text: Call me a sucker, but I love the creative drink menus here. Last time I visited trick dog, the drink menu was on a record and this time around it was on a horoscope. Totes cute!   The drinks are hand crafted and remind me of bourbon and branch (drinks that takes a while but totally worth it). It can get pretty crowded in there as well. I've never had the food but it looks bomb.   I had a bad experience this past weekend with one of the guests. He dropped drinks all over our groups' jackets. Having said that, you're going to find drunk a*holes at every bar.

lSHmOC77AF3vpvDDeUcXiw.review_text: This place has some pros and it has some cons. But first, let me start by sharing what came in the drink I ordered last Saturday:   - Tequila - Tangerine  - Dill - Lime - EGG WHITE - Maccha   Yes, egg white. And let me tell you... it was amazing. Seriously, one of the weirdest but best drinks I've had. It was the Libra and it was on the front of the menu where they have all of the zodiac signs which represent drinks. Very cool, and such a unique drink.   So the first pro here is that they have awesome drinks. The second pro would be the atmosphere. It has a real cocktail bar feel, and the bartenders all really know what they are doing. Loved that about this place.   The downside is definitely the lack of bar seating and the fact that it is uncomfortably crowded. Once you order a drink, you're kind of just stranded in the middle. There is kind of a place to stand and set you drink along the back wall, but good luck squirming your way into finding a spot to stand. I was with a group of 4 and it just wasn't really happening.   I will definitely come back, mainly for the atmosphere and the drinks. I think this is more of a Tuesday night type place versus a weekend night.

P5bUL3Engv-2z6kKohB6qQ.review_text: Im a fan of the Bon Vivant crew. Theyve done drink programs for many good restaurants in SF. Always solid drinks with interesting approaches to the classic cocktail. Recently I went to a party here that was wall to wall people. The Space is basically a long rectangular room with an upstairs having s few tables. Considering the standing room only first floor, the bartenders were on their game and actually got the drinks to us in a timely manner. I asked my bartender to make something of her choice with bourbon, while my friend got the non alcoholic pineapple/coconut selection. Both fairly solid drinks. I wish i was there longer to try a few more but between talking to people i knew all over the room and the parking restrictions we had to adhere to for my friends car, we had to cut out early.  One of my co workers loves the burger here so she keeps telling me i should have it. One day im going to come back on a more normal service and have food plus a few more drinks to see how they usually run. However even with these crowded, busy condition, they delivered a good time. 4.25 stars

xrCSgvVZpt6vkNGjsRKLpg.review_text: Trick Dog is your cure for Monday night. Dinner with a lively happy hour downstairs = escape the hum drum. Keisha gave lovely service and payed such close attention to my table for one. Had a glass of cab and the skirt steak ... delicious!

CVnZomk9V2HoW3ihJh_R8g.review_text: There isn't a sign, so either memorize the address, or look for an industrial loft, packed even on a Monday, where the cocktail glasses are too fancy for the building. Having browsed the menu and steeled ourselves for a night of deep-fried meat, we ordered most things to share: The Pickle Plate: was really diverse, and not too sour, ranging from spicy, to curried cauliflower, to caraway cabbage. The Kale Salad could hardly count as our evening's vegetable (if cooked down it would have been Kale Gratin) but creamy mild dressing, tons of snowy parmesan, and rich pepitas made it meal-worthy. I've waited too long to try a Scotch Egg and this one, surrounded by Brandade instead of ground meat, will have me trying more.  Despite having 4 condiments, they all worked together, or separately as I toured my plate. The Manimal Style Thrice-Cooked Fries had me worried with their pallid color, but they were crunchy on the outside, creamy on the inside, and of course, covered in nouveau Thousand Island and some sort of dark and mysterious stand in for caramelized onions that I thought were seaweed, and my boyfriend thought were, well, caramelized green onions.  I concede that he's probably right.  Despite losing that bet (anyone feel free to back me up) this was the best thing I ate that night...and the week before. The Shrimp Cocktail was a bit scant--4 shrimp in a wee dish with a spoonful of horseradish and a spoonful of their smoothly ketchup-like bloody mary mix.  While not for lovers of chunky, iced, old school Shrimp Cocktail, this dish is for lovers of raw shrimp--sweet, mild and tender. I would never have ordered the rice plate, but for chicken-lovers and traditionalists, this little dinner of a deep fried rice block and tender chicken thighs is for you. Last was the Trick Dog.  If you want an amazing, artery-clogging burger and fries, come to Trick Dog and get a Trick Dog and Thrice-Cooked Fries. While it is it's own tomato-less (and virtually lettuce-less) beast of high percentage meats, cheese and creamy sauce, when combined with the perfect fries, this could be the best burger dinner in town.  Just add a cocktail. The cocktails veered a little farther from their ancestors...and were a little less palatable.  All pretty and creative, each tended to be overwhelmed by a token flavor.  The Mr. Big Stuff tasted like sunscreen (coconut).  The Evil Woman had the dark spice of dried chiles, and little else.  The Ain't No Sunshine was overpowered by the coffee liquor, there was one that tasted like burning rubber (mezcal), and there was even one that just tasted like lemon juice.* I'm not a whiskey drinker, but the Bankrobber was my favorite of the night. Rounded, warm, sweet: it's token flavor would have to be the spirit of Christmases yet to come.  *I'm a sip mooch. I didn't actually finish all of these.

ZBLZIOrO3DZJzDFlFO-bJw.review_text: It's the epitome of Mission gentrification but I liked it. No signage indicates where the place is but you can figure it out. Their drink menu is a pantone booklet which is creative. I really liked their Gypsy Tan drink. It was BUSY on a Saturday night. A lot of stylish people in a stylish bar. It's a winner if that is your scene. PS: Parking is tricky in that neighborhood.

gMuoaaZZ2BsBiXuVCHh5zg.review_text: The boyfriend and I came here around 5pm on a Tuesday night. It was pretty crowded in the bar area, but having heard about how great the food was, we headed upstairs to for an early dinner. We ordered:  Food: The Scotch Egg- I liked the idea, but I think many people are fooled by the plating. Plus, the egg has a very fishy tasting layer between the egg and the breading. Nothing should every be fishy tasting. Even fish. Yuck.  The Trick Dog-A pretty solid burger, but it wasn't good enough to make me want to return here just for this one dish. Cracklins- very good, but fried fat is not so hard to get wrong.   Drinks: Pennies from Heaven- interesting, but I only had one sip because it was too alcohol-tasting for me, but I am really not a big drinker, so I always feel very biased whenever I give a drink review. Grandma's Sweater- This was pretty good and balanced with the right amount of sweet, sour, and alcohol flavor. It didn't have the alcohol taste as much, but it was still a very strong drink! I drank about half and had to stop.   Our food came out before the drinks, which no one ever likes, but I know the bar was busy downstairs. The service was okay, not really much to discuss there. Although, the waitress did apologize for the drinks coming out slowly. Overall, I thought this meal was disappointing and overpriced for what we had. I think if I had out of town guests who were more into scene and ambiance, I would bring them here, but this wouldn't be a place for me to return any time soon.

jq77_4r-l3ENM7lT37z0AA.review_text: Trick Dog was pretty confusing. First off, it was kind of off-putting that my friend had to get his ID out twice, because the guy in front forgot that he already looked it.  Going in, the place was a madhouse, probably because it was prime time happy hour. Had to fight to get to the bar, and decided that we were going to stay in. After waiting for 10 minutes for a table, and looking at the menu, we found it that it wasn't too appealing and decided to head back down at the bar, just so we can get a drink and leave. (Though, the food looked pretty good..)  I ended up getting Hunter's Moon, which was on their lighter menu, and let me just say, the bartender did not skip on the "light" part, because there was plenty of alcohol in there. My friends got the Aries and the Pisces, both were really tasty and refreshing.  Would come back for the drinks, maybe not when I have to fight for it.

bTFZ-cepM91pdS2PFpvJiA.review_text: good drinks. good atmosphere. friendly staff.  love when you can give a bartender a general "flavor" of what you want and they provide you with exactly what you want...and it taste GOOD.  we each wanted something different - refreshing, fruity/delicious and whisky.  the guy did good and we were all pleased and left with a nice buzz after just 1 drink.  will have to go back and grab a table upstairs for some drink AND food.  also, creative "records" menu and trick dog decor will have you busting out your phone for instagram worthy pics. just sayin'..

r9fa2Kz54dJ1AgCIL52Ipw.review_text: Went with 2 friends on a Wednesday night, crowded but not unbearable. The bartenders are fast and friendly and the drinks were interesting and delicious... Pennies from heaven, baby turtle were stand outs.  We waited to grab a table to eat, about 40 minutes, goes by fast when you have a little buzzzz ;) Food was very good as well.  Great prices, trick dog is the way to go, also shrimp cocktail, pimento cheese dip and ovaltine ice cream. Can't wait to go back.

ZI0grFN6uDCjnOspzBVtcA.review_text: great drinks but too crowded! came on a thursday night and forgot it was a skool nite cuz there were so many folks. waited at bar for like 20 minutes and got grammas sweater. very good.  people seemed to love the sidecar too. bartenders seem to know what they are doing. and semi-friendly too. prolly would like the bar more on a day when i have more patience. :/

mtl9Z6oZg9mUuyl96J8xBg.review_text: I give this place an "Inc".  Stopped in there one evening a few months back while waiting on a table at Central Kitchen.  It was pretty crowded, which is to be expected on a Saturday evening at the new "it" cocktail joint.  Once I managed to slip and slide my way up to the bar so I could order a Baby Turtle, I was pretty much ignored by the "mixologist".  Waited about 10 more minutes and then hit the road through the back hallway and sat on the fountain with a nice beer at Central Kitchen.  I chalked this one up to being slammed on a Saturday night and everyone else south of Chestnut Street wanting to be there.
